dispatchMultiWindowModeChanged(boolean).Description: Lets all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager know the multi-window mode of the activity changed. Call when the multi-window mode of the activity changed.

reportLoaderStart().Description: Lets the loaders know the host is ready to receive notifications.

retainNestedNonConfig().Description: Returns a nested tree of Fragments that have opted to retain their instance across configuration changes.

dispatchPause().Description: Moves all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager into the pause state. Call when Fragments should be paused.

dispatchStop().Description: Moves all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager into the stop state. Call when Fragments should be stopped.

retainNonConfig().Description: use @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentController#retainNestedNonConfig_E@ to also track retained nested child fragments Returns a list of Fragments that have opted to retain their instance across configuration changes.

dispatchLowMemory().Description: Lets all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager know the device is in a low memory condition. Call when the device is low on memory and Fragment's should trim their memory usage.

dispatchDestroy().Description: Moves all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager into the destroy state. Call when Fragments should be destroyed.

retainLoaderNonConfig().Description: Returns a list of LoaderManagers that have opted to retain their instance across configuration changes.

dispatchActivityCreated().Description: Moves all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager into the activity created state. Call when Fragments should be informed their host has been created.

saveAllState().Description: Saves the state for all Fragments.

Returns: true if the options menu contains items to display
dispatchPrepareOptionsMenu(android.view..Description: Lets all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager know they should prepare their options menu for display. Call immediately before displaying the Fragment's options menu.

getActiveFragmentsCount().Description: Returns the number of active fragments.

noteStateNotSaved().Description: Marks the fragment state as unsaved. This allows for "state loss" detection.

dispatchPictureInPictureModeChanged(bool.Description: Lets all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager know the picture-in-picture mode of the activity changed. Call when the picture-in-picture mode of the activity changed.

dispatchStart().Description: Moves all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager into the start state. Call when Fragments should be started.

doLoaderRetain().Description: Retains the state of each of the loaders.

attachHost(android.support.v4.app.Fragme.Description: Attaches the host to the FragmentManager for this controller. The host must be attached before the FragmentManager can be used to manage Fragments.

dispatchCreate().Description: Moves all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager into the create state. Call when Fragments should be created.

dispatchResume().Description: Moves all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager into the resume state. Call when Fragments should be resumed.

Returns: true if the context menu selection event was consumed
dispatchContextItemSelected(android.view.Description: Sends a context item selection event to the Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager. Once the event has been consumed, no additional handling will be performed. Call immediately after an options menu item has been selected

Returns: true if the options menu selection event was consumed
dispatchOptionsItemSelected(android.view.Description: Sends an option item selection event to the Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager. Once the event has been consumed, no additional handling will be performed. Call immediately after an options menu item has been selected

Returns: true if queued actions were performed
execPendingActions().Description: Execute any pending actions for the Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager. Call when queued actions can be performed [eg when the Fragment moves into a start or resume state].

dispatchDestroyView().Description: Moves all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager into the destroy view state. Call when the Fragment's views should be destroyed.

doLoaderDestroy().Description: Destroys the loaders and, if their state is not being retained, removes them.

dispatchOptionsMenuClosed(android.view.M.Description: Lets all Fragments managed by the controller's FragmentManager know their options menu has closed. Call immediately after closing the Fragment's options menu.

Parameters: boolean: When true, the loaders aren't stopped, but, their instances are retained in a started state
doLoaderStop(boolean).Description: Stops the loaders, optionally retaining their state. This is useful for keeping the loader state across configuration changes.

findFragmentByWho(java.lang.String).Description: Returns a fragment with the given identifier.

ClassDesc: Provides integration points with a @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentManager_E@ for a fragment host. It is the responsibility of the host to take care of the Fragment's lifecycle. The methods provided by @B_android#support#v4#app#FragmentController_E@ are for that purpose.
